title: Waistcoat, 1785–1800
medium:
Material: silk
Technique: lampas (twill weave plus plain weave)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Gentleman's waistcoat with a small overall pattern and neo-classical leafy sprays symmetrically arranged down the center front, in taupe on an olive green ground. At the lower edge, a "frieze" of the Triumph of Cupid in blue and white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat, 1785–1800.
1785–1800. Material: silk
Technique: lampas (twill weave plus plain weave). Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-14.
